meanings.definition: To throw or hurl something with force
meanings.sent1: He was slinging the ball across the field.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys slinging frisbees at the park.
meanings.sent3: The monkey started slinging bananas at the zoo visitors.
meanings.sent4: The storm was slinging raindrops against the window.
meanings.sent5: The chef was slinging pizza dough in the air with skill.

meanings.definition: To sell or promote something aggressively
meanings.sent1: The salesman was slinging the latest gadgets to customers.
meanings.sent2: They were slinging hotdogs at the baseball game.
meanings.sent3: The kids were slinging lemonade on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent4: The company was slinging discounts during the holiday season.
meanings.sent5: The street performer was slinging CDs of his music to passersby.

meanings.sent1: Her bag was slinging off her shoulder as she walked.
meanings.sent2: The hammock was slinging between two trees in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: The cat was slinging its tail lazily in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The vines were slinging down from the old tree branches.
meanings.sent5: The scarf was slinging elegantly around her neck.
